text: hey everybody thomas joseph here and

alright guys before we get started with

here this crabbing is from blue crab
which is really popular here on the east

people if you're out on the west coast
you might have access to Dungeness crab
which also has really great lump
crabmeat that you can use in a crab cake
now crab cakes are probably the most
popular in the Atlantic area Maryland
Virginia and a true Maryland crab cake
has a lot of crab meat in it with not so
many fillers and if you can get this
really fresh sweet lump crabmeat from
your local fish shop really try to do it
now it's kind of best to get the
freshest meat as possible but oftentimes
you might be presented with pasteurized
crabmeat which isn't necessarily ideal
because what happens is the crab is kind
of cooked within the can or the
container that it's in and so it has a
slightly different flavor and not so
great of a texture so if you can get
fresh that should be your first choice
the one thing that you want to make sure
when you're buying crab meat is that
that doesn't have any sort of fishy
smell it should be nice and sweet big

so this is one pound of jumbo lump

chives add a nice little bit of bite and

now I need a couple of tablespoons for
the inside of a crab cake but the rest
we can use as garnish you do want to

mayonnaise
now mayonnaise is really fantastic

oil which is really great fats that's

butter has fantastic flavor
the oils neutral so using a combination
